attributes.comment:
In regards to docket # USCIS-2006-0044 I would like to voice my concerns over
significantly raising these adoption related fees.
With adoption (domestic and international) is already quite expensive it is
unreasonable to raise the USCIS associated fees even more. Many people would
like to be able to afford adoption but with the spiraling costs and ever changing
country requirements for adoption, many people are left unable to financially afford
it, leaving many too many children in state insitutions, foster homes, or
orphanages.
With international adoption the timeframe continues to lengthen for many countries
before a referral or match is given. These required documents are time sensitive
and in many cases expire before a referral is made, making it necessary for
couples to renew not only their I600/I600A and fingerprints but their I171 as well
sometimes up to three times.
The costs for these fees are not calculated within your adoption fees and therefore
must be paid each time out of pocket by the adopting couple. This can result in
thousands of additional dollars spent, out of pocket, by the couple that has to
process these forms/fingerprints up to three times before their adoption in finalized.
Adoption is done for many reasons, mostly because loving people want a
child/children and are willing and able to open their homes and hearts to children
that would not otherwise have such opportunities and loving families to provide for
them.
Please rethink the issue of raising such fees as it will make it even more
financially difficult for adoptive families to begin and complete their adoption
process.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
